Package com.example.freeturilo.dialogs

Class MailNotifyDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      • androidx.fragment.app.DialogFragment
        • com.example.freeturilo.dialogs.MailNotifyDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
    public class MailNotifyDialog
extends androidx.fragment.app.DialogFragment
    A dialog for managing mail notifications.

    Object of this class is used to manage the threshold of reports of a station at which an administrator receives a mail notification. This dialog shows a view customized for mail notifications management. When created, retrieves the current value of the threshold from api. When its positive button is clicked, it should eventually call the positiveCallback.

    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Miko≈Çaj Terzyk
    See Also:

      • onPositiveButton

        private void onPositiveButton​(@NonNull
                              android.content.DialogInterface dialog)
        Handles a positive button click.

        Validates input data of this dialog. If validation passes, the managed positiveCallback is called with set threshold value and this dialog is dismissed.

        Parameters:
        dialog - the shown dialog
        See Also:
        validate()

      • validate

        private boolean validate()
        Validates input data of this dialog.

        If the switch is checked and threshold input does not contain a positive integer, a validation error occurs.

        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether validation has passed
